description: End users experience significant instability due to the Windows mobile broadband driver, which has a remote code execution vulnerability. This may manifest as unexpected system behavior where applications crash or freeze, potentially leading to data loss during use. Users may see error messages indicating service interruptions after installing related updates or security patches, such as KB5037771, KB5037770, and KB5037768. The affected builds include various Windows 10 and 11 versions, specifically builds 10.0.19045.4412, 10.0.22631.3593, and others. Given the nature of the vulnerability, any physical manipulation or connection of a malicious USB device could exacerbate these issues, making user vigilance crucial.
